# Introduction

```{r echo=FALSE, out.width="33%"}
knitr::include_graphics("figures/full.png")
```

This website contain text and code for the forthcoming O'Reilly book: [Efficient R programming](https://csgillespie.github.io/efficientR/). Pull requests and general comments are welcome.

## Dependencies for this book

The book depends on the following packages from CRAN:

```{r echo=FALSE}
desc = read.dcf("DESCRIPTION")
headings = dimnames(desc)[[2]]
fields = which(headings %in% c("Depends", "Imports", "Suggests"))
pkgs = paste(desc[fields], collapse = ", ")
pkgs = gsub("\n", " ", pkgs)
pkgs = strsplit(pkgs, ",")[[1]]
pkgs = gsub(" ", "", pkgs)
pkgs = pkgs[order(pkgs)]
pkgs_df = data.frame(Name = pkgs, Title = NA)
for(i in seq_along(pkgs)){
  f = system.file(package = pkgs[i], "DESCRIPTION")
  # Title is always on 3rd line
  title = readLines(f)
  title = title[grep("Title: ", title)]
  pkgs_df$Title[i] = gsub("Title: ", "", title)
}
knitr::kable(pkgs_df)
```

These packages can be installed via
```{r eval=FALSE}
devtools::install_github("csgillespie/efficientR")
```

Two additional github packages are required for building the book:

```{r eval=FALSE}
gh_pkgs = c("csgillespie/efficient_pkg", "rstudio/bookdown")
devtools::install_github(gh_pkgs)
```

Then run the following command.

```{r eval=FALSE}
bookdown::render_book("index.Rmd", output_format = bookdown::pdf_book())
```
